metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0066 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The chkpass extension in PostgreSQL before 8.4.20, 9.0.x before 9.0.16, 9.1.x before 9.1.12, 9.2.x before 9.2.7, and 9.3.x before 9.3.3 does not properly check the return value of the crypt library function, which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and crash) via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0066` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

postgresql-plperl-9.1 - 9.1.12-1
No subscription required

libecpg-compat3 - 9.3.3-1
libecpg6 - 9.3.3-1
libpgtypes3 - 9.3.3-1
libpq5 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-client-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-contrib-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-plperl-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-plpython-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-plpython3-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
postgresql-pltcl-9.3 - 9.3.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.1.12-1').
postgresql-9.3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.3.3-1').
